River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to the lush grasslands that the miners fought to seize. The film is a recreation of a documented historical event - the Land wars between the Maori and the settlers that tore apart communities, training fields and left most of the New Zealanders unhappy and disheartened.
